title: [Bug]: 2.1.0 uses dark mode for window decorations
body: ### Can you reproduce this bug in the website/PWA? Not applicable ### Describe the bug The Teams window uses dark mode *for window decorations* (the app itself does not!), although I'm using normal (ie. not dark) mode on my desktop. I'm running a GNOME-Flashback session in X11 on Slackware64-15.0. ### What package are you using? tar.gz ### Version 2.1.0 ### Reproduction steps ```markdown 1. start Teams 2. see dark mode window decorations ``` ### Expected Behavior ```markdown 1. start Teams 2. see standard (light mode) window decorations ``` ### Debug ```markdown [zlatko@disclosure:~]$ teams-for-linux --webDebug --logConfig='{}' No config file found, using default values Initialising logger with config: "{}" 10:08:49.691 › File logging at /home/zlatko/.config/teams-for-linux/logs/main.log with level silly 10:08:49.693 › Console logging enabled with level silly 10:08:49.693 › Logger initialised 10:08:49.694 › configPath: /home/zlatko/.config/teams-for-linux 10:08:49.694 › configFile: {} 10:08:49.786 › (node:6106) [DEP0180] DeprecationWarning: fs.Stats constructor is deprecated.
